body.p:
You can use one of the following license types with :
A named-user license may be used by a single on one or more computers. Named-user licenses are not transferable to a new . If you order multiple named-user licenses, you will receive a single license key good for a specified number of named users. It is your responsibility to keep track of the named users that each license is assigned to.
A floating license may be used by any user on any machine. However, the total number of copies of in use at one time must not be more than the number of floating licenses available. A user who runs two different distributions of (for example, Standalone and Eclipse Plugin) at the same time on the same computer, consumes a single floating license.
A special academic license (classroom, department or site license) may be used by students and teachers in academic institutions. These licenses provide a cost effective way of getting access to for learning purposes.
A site license may be used by all the people that belong to the organization that purchased the site license.
For definitions and legal details of the license types, consult the End User License Agreement available at .
